subject: Re: [junit] use of setUp and tearDown
msgSnippet: ... Because repeated profiling has never suggested it might be a hot spot in my code. -- Elliotte Rusty Harold  elharo@metalab.unc.edu XML in a Nutshell 3rd
messageBody:
Cedric Beust wrote:

> So my question to you is: why do you reparse this file on every test method
> when it's not necessary? Because JUnit doesn't give you any
> "setUp/tearDown" method around classes?

Because repeated profiling has never suggested it might be a hot spot in
my code.

--
Elliotte Rusty Harold elharo@...
